nl.uu.cs.ias.pursuerevader.game
Class AgentListener

java.lang.Object
  nl.uu.cs.ias.pursuerevader.game.AgentListener

public class AgentListener
extends java.lang.Object

AgentListener

The AgentListener class serves as an interface between the AI and the agents (the pursuer and the evader), because Agent class holds methods that are not allowed to be used when implementing an AI for this game. When starting the game, both the evader and pursuer will have an AgentListener attached to them, which can be used to retrieve all necessary information to implement a sophisticated AI.

Author:
M.v.Zee
See Also:

getHeading

public double getHeading()
Returns the heading of the agent in radians. When the agent faces north, the heading will be zero, and it increases clockwise, so that the angle of the direction east will be PI/2

Returns:
Heading

getMaxTurnAngle

public double getMaxTurnAngle()
Returns the maximal turn rate of the agent. A turn rate is defined as the change in heading per tick.

Returns:
The maximal heading of the agent

getAngleWith

public double getAngleWith(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double p0)
Returns the angle in radians that the agent makes with a given point, where direction north in the GUI represents an angle of 0. The angle is measured clockwise, so direction east will return an angle of PI/2

Parameters:
p0 - The point to calculate the angle with
Returns:

setNextTurnAngle

public void setNextTurnAngle(double angle)
Define the next turn for the agent to take. This only works for the evader agent, since this is the agent that requires an AI. The pursuer agent comes with a build-in AI that needs to be defeated.

Parameters:
angle - The angle that the agent needs to turn with in the next tick. This can be a value between 0 and 2*PI. A positive angle will make the agent move in a clockwise direction. Negative values are also accepted, and translated into their corresponding direction. A negative turning angle of x will result in a turning angle of 2*PI-x.
